judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Boberts and Pomeroy, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The order of the Court of Common Pleas of Montgomery County is vacated, and the case is remanded to that Court for a rehearing, with instructions that Abington Township be joined as a party defendant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Peter F. Baughman, with him Waters, Fleer, Cooper & Colleger, for appellant.
Desmond J. McTighe, with him Philip D. Weiss, and McTighe, Koch, Brown & Weiss, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Hankin v. Harbison, Appellant.
Argued May 1, 1969.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Boberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
reargument refused December 19, 1969.
Peter F. Baughman, with him Waters, Fleer, Cooper & Colleger, for appellant.
Desmond J. McTighe, with him Philip D. Weiss, and McTighe, Koch, Brown & Weiss, for appellees.
November 12, 1969:
